let's get an overview of amazon rds service it is a relational database
service that is managed and is available for choice of six popular database hinges
it is available for amazon aurora mysql postgresql mariadb and microsoft sql
server as well as for oracle in case of oracle it is available for enterprise edition
and for the standard edition the major features of amazon rds service
are easy to administer meaning it is very easy to provision an rds database within few minutes with
the os and the database software that you want and have the built-in monitoring also
provided with the database the data in your database is always encrypted at rest and also
in transit using ssl and it meets the all industry compliance and assurance
programs and assures that your data will remain secure at all times
it is also highly available and durable using automatic multi-easy database configuration that
uses synchronous replication to keep two copies of the database in two availability zone in
synchronization and they can be filled over if one of the instance fails also there
are automated backups and manual snapshots available which can then be
used to retain the data as long as you want to monitor the database we have amazon
cloud watch available in amazon rds as well as oem can also be
used to monitor the rds oracle database there is a minimal downtime
for your application when the database instance has to be scaled the storage can be auto
scaled but the cpu and the memory can also be scaled in or scale out depending upon your need
with a minimal downtime
when a database server is provisioned and hosted on-prem then all of the responsibilities
and operations required to maintain the operating system and the database software on that
server as well as the database the high availability of the database backups scaling all of these
responsibilities fall upon the customer or your team when such database server is moved into
amazon cloud on ec2 amazon provide provisions the server
and then also installs the operating system on that server after that the root access is provided
to the customer and then customer can then apply the patches to the operating system and install the database software as
well as maintain the database by taking database backups and have available by handling high
availability and scaling in case of rds service rds service if the database is moved
into amazon rds then amazon not only provisions the server but it also maintains the
operating system installs the correct database software patches the database software
as well as maintains the database by taking automated backups and providing high availability with
scaling in and out as as your demand varies so your team can now focus on
application optimization and performance of the application and then provide the best experience
for your end users
when provisioning rds oracle database in with amazon rds service you have two
options to secure the licenses for running oracle database first option is where the license is
included with the price of the rds service there is no need to purchase separate oracle licenses for

is to bring your own license that you have directly purchased from oracle maybe you are using it for
running a database on-prem then those licenses can also be brought over to amazon
and used to run the oracle database in amazon rds in this particular case the since the
licenses are purchased from oracle the support is also goes through the oracle support
for oracle standard edition both options are available and because of license
included option it is very easy to quickly provision a standard edition database
in amazon rds
once you choose to use oracle standard edition 2 then you have two choices to host it

oracle sc2 on ec2 server is available in the multi ac
configuration for amazon rds when it is running or a constructed edition
too you can set up two databases as one as being primary another one being standby and the
automatic failover is then possible if the primary database fails or if the availability zone
in which that primary database is running becomes unavailable as far as encryption is
concerned there is no encryption available in oracle standard edition 2
for the data at rest while it is available for data in transit
using oracle native network encryption and ssl and tls security
in case of amazon rds though we have amazon kms available in which either amazon
generated key or the customer generated key can be stored and be used to encrypt the data at rest
and of course oracle uh nne and ssl tls is available for
encrypting the data in transit for monitoring and tuning there are no
direct tools available like diagnostic pack or that is available in enterprise
edition is not available in standard edition 2 but oracle start spec
is available which can be used to run the report for analysis on the if you run the
standard edition 2 on amazon rds then you can use amazon cloud watch for
monitoring as well as amazon performance insights with enhanced monitoring is available to
dive deep into the tuning data of the oracle standard edition 2 database and of course start spec
diagnostic reports are available as they are on the oracle c2 running on
ec2 server for backups there are no direct automated backups
available when you run or reconstructed edition 2 on ec2 you will have to write the scripts test
then and then implement them to perform regular backups but in amazon rds automated backups are
available which can be retained up to 35 days and on-demand backups
can be taken using amazon rds snapshots and those can be retained up to unlimited
for unlimited time there are no automated backups available in standard
edition 2 when it is running on ec2 server to create the backup and store it
at the remote location for dr purposes but in amazon rds amazon cross region
automated backups are available to support the dr objectives meaning
your backups can be copied automatically from your primary region to the target region where it can be
restored in case of a disaster recovery

can also be taken whenever needed and those snapshots then can be retained to unlimited up to

cross region automated backups in which the snapshots are copied along with the archive logs
to the another region is also available in both editions to support the dr configurations the

archive logs will be copied and then copied to another region
where they can be used to recover the database to point in time the point in time

watch is a native aws service using which you can monitor the aws
instance that is running the database and look at the cpu utilization storage utilization
and memory utilization and determine the bottlenecks for your database
performance similarly oracle enterprise manager can be installed on prem or into aws and oracle

edition and in standard edition the diagnostic and tuning pack is available only in oracle enterprise
edition and that provides the awr repository which collects the snapshots of the database with
with all the performance metrics in case of rds oracle standard edition 2 this same

to to get the details of the performance of the database
sql plan management is available in enterprise edition using sql t and multiple different
methods outlines as well as baselines are available to pin the execution plans
of the sql statements to have a consistent performance same facility is also available same
feature is also available in oracle standard edition too but the use of baselines is limited to one per sql
statement now let us look at the high availability
and disaster recovery configuration in both oracle enterprise edition and standard edition 2.
we measure these both features using two measures one is rpo which is recovery point
objective meaning how much data would be lost in when recovered through the option that is given below
and then rto is a recovery time objective is how long it is going to take
to recover this data so in first option the multi ac for high
availability in this case there are two databases running at all times
and the replication is performed at the storage level synchronously at a time only one database out of these
two is available for the application and state second database continuously
remains in sync with the primary database when the failure occurs in the primary
database the database fails over and the secondary database becomes primary
and immediately your application can resume the operation again in this case there is zero data
loss as the replication is performed synchronously at the storage level the recovery time is up to one to two
minutes while the primary database goes down and the standby database takes over the
operation of the primary database in case of snapshot restore it is a snapshot that is taken
as a point in time so in that case depending upon when the snapshot was taken
the rpo can be hours but the recovery is much faster in within less than an
hour that snapshot can be restored and direct another oracle instance and the database
can become available no matter what the size of the database is this is accomplished using a lazy
restore meaning that the database is restored with important components and is made
available to the application and rest of the database that is that is the larger
data files keep on restoring in background but the database is immediately available for the application to work
and as data is required by application to process it is brought in from the snapshot that
are in s3 to the rds distance the point in time restore
in within the region within the same region can happen or can happen within hours but the data
lost would be on the last five minutes as we mentioned before archive logs are copied in
every five minutes to the s3 backup and thus there is no data loss beyond
five minutes once the if the recovery is done in point in time anytime between five
minutes to up to 35 days but in case of cross region point in time recovery the recovery
point objective or the data loss can be up to 25 minutes could be from 5 minutes to 25 minutes
depending upon how long it took or how long it took to copy all the archive logs and files
to the another region which could be thousands of miles away
